priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Relation to Reference Period Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66728

self.title: CDISC SDTM Relation to Reference Period Terminology

definition: The relative relationship of a timepoint to a reference timepoint.
name: Relation to Reference Period
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Relation to Reference Period Terminology

terms.definition: The time period following a point or another period of time. (NCI)
Occurring or operating at the same time.
At some point in a given period of time. (NCI)
Within a certain period of time or after a certain point or period in time. (NCI)
Remain in force or carry on without letup; keep or maintain in unaltered condition; exist in time or space without stop or interruption. (NCI)
Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused. (NCI)
